message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.DC 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Science sub-category of Network and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) as it deals with Internet eXchange Points (IXPs) and their impact on the Internet topology and economy. It may also belong to the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) as it discusses the contentious debate within the network operators' community regarding remote peering. Additionally, it could be classified under Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) as it characterizes different aspects of the remote peering ecosystem. Cybersecurity and Privacy (cs.CY) is another possible sub-category as the paper deals with the security implications of remote peering. Finally, Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) could be a relevant sub-category as the paper discusses the growth of IXPs and their impact on distributed computing.
